_meta.description: Mock database for Zora African Market - UK-based African grocery marketplace

vendors.description: Authentic West African spices and seasonings sourced directly from family farms in Nigeria and Ghana. Specializing in premium jollof spice blends, suya seasoning, and traditional soup ingredients.
Premium fresh African produce delivered to your door. We source the freshest vegetables, fruits, and imported goods directly from trusted suppliers across Africa.
Your one-stop shop for authentic African haircare and skincare products. From shea butter to black soap, we bring you the best beauty secrets from Africa.
Authentic East African fabrics and textiles. From Kitenge to Kanga, we offer the finest quality African fabrics for fashion and home decor.
Premium Ethiopian coffee beans roasted to perfection. Experience the birthplace of coffee with our authentic Yirgacheffe and Sidamo blends.
Bringing the flavors of North Africa to London. Authentic Moroccan spices, preserved lemons, harissa, and traditional tagine ingredients.
Authentic South African biltong and droëwors made the traditional way. Premium cuts of beef, perfectly seasoned and air-dried to perfection.

regions.name: West Africa
regions.description: Jollof rice, suya, fufu, and the bold flavors of West Africa

regions.name: East Africa
regions.description: Ethiopian coffee, injera, pilau, and East African traditions

regions.name: North Africa
regions.description: Tagines, couscous, harissa, and Mediterranean-African fusion

regions.name: South Africa
regions.description: Biltong, bobotie, peri-peri, and South African braai culture

regions.name: Central Africa
regions.description: Moambe, pondu, cassava dishes, and rainforest flavors

products.name: Jollof Seasoning Mix
products.description: Our signature jollof spice blend, carefully crafted with tomatoes, onions, scotch bonnet peppers, and a secret blend of traditional spices. Perfect for making authentic Nigerian or Ghanaian jollof rice.
products.heritage_story: This blend has been perfected over three generations of our family, originating from a small village in Lagos State, Nigeria.

products.name: Suya Spice Mix
products.description: Authentic Nigerian suya spice blend made with ground peanuts, ginger, garlic, and cayenne pepper. Transform your grilled meats into street-food perfection.
products.heritage_story: Inspired by the famous suya stands of Northern Nigeria, where the art of grilling has been perfected over centuries.

products.name: Ethiopian Berbere Spice
products.description: A fiery and aromatic Ethiopian spice blend featuring chili peppers, fenugreek, coriander, cardamom, and black pepper. Essential for authentic doro wat and other Ethiopian dishes.
products.heritage_story: Sourced from the highlands of Ethiopia where berbere has been the soul of cooking for over a thousand years.

products.name: Egusi Seeds (Ground)
products.description: Premium ground melon seeds, essential for making the beloved Nigerian egusi soup. Rich, nutty, and perfect for thickening your traditional soups.
products.heritage_story: Egusi is a staple across West Africa, and our seeds are sourced from cooperative farms in Nigeria's middle belt.

products.name: Dried Scotch Bonnet Peppers
products.description: Intensely flavorful dried scotch bonnet peppers. Perfect for adding authentic heat to your African dishes. Rehydrate or grind to use.
products.heritage_story: These peppers are sun-dried using traditional methods passed down through generations in Ghana.

products.name: Turmeric Powder (Nigerian)
products.description: Vibrant golden turmeric powder sourced from Nigerian farms. Rich in curcumin, perfect for curries, rice dishes, and health drinks.
products.heritage_story: Turmeric has been used in West African traditional medicine for centuries, and our supply comes from organic farms in Kaduna State.

products.name: Fresh Plantains (Ripe)
products.description: Sweet, ripe plantains perfect for frying or baking. Imported fresh from West Africa and ripened naturally.
products.heritage_story: Plantains are a staple across Africa. Our plantains are sourced from sustainable farms in Ghana.

products.name: Cassava (Fresh)
products.description: Fresh cassava roots, perfect for making fufu, garri, or boiled cassava. Carefully selected for quality.
products.heritage_story: Cassava is the foundation of many African cuisines. Ours comes fresh from farms in Nigeria.

products.name: Dried Okra (Okro)
products.description: Sun-dried okra slices, perfect for traditional soups like okra soup or as a thickening agent. Long shelf life and intense flavor.
products.heritage_story: Dried using traditional sun-drying methods in the savannah regions of Nigeria.

products.name: Palm Oil (Red)
products.description: Authentic unrefined red palm oil, the heart of West African cooking. Rich, flavorful, and packed with natural vitamins.
products.heritage_story: Our palm oil comes from sustainable plantations in the Niger Delta, processed using traditional methods.

products.name: Ethiopian Yirgacheffe Coffee
products.description: Single-origin Ethiopian coffee from the Yirgacheffe region. Known for its bright, fruity flavors with notes of jasmine and citrus. Medium roast.
products.heritage_story: Ethiopia is the birthplace of coffee. These beans come from family farms in the Yirgacheffe highlands.

products.name: Kente Cloth - Gold Pattern
products.description: Authentic hand-woven Kente cloth from Ghana. Traditional gold and green pattern, perfect for special occasions and cultural celebrations.
products.heritage_story: Kente cloth originated with the Ashanti people of Ghana and has been woven for over 400 years.

products.name: Pure Shea Butter (Unrefined)
products.description: 100% pure, unrefined shea butter from Ghana. Perfect for moisturizing skin and hair. Rich in vitamins A and E.
products.heritage_story: Shea butter has been used by African women for centuries. Ours is hand-crafted by women's cooperatives in Ghana.

products.name: African Black Soap
products.description: Traditional African black soap made with plantain skins, cocoa pod ash, and palm oil. Gentle cleansing for face and body.
products.heritage_story: Black soap has been made in West Africa for generations. Our recipe comes from traditional soap makers in Ghana.

products.name: Moroccan Ras el Hanout
products.description: Premium Moroccan spice blend with over 25 spices including cardamom, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and rose petals. The king of spice blends.
products.heritage_story: Each spice merchant in Morocco has their own secret blend. Ours comes from a family in Marrakech with 150 years of spice trading history.

products.name: Premium Beef Biltong
products.description: Traditional South African dried beef, seasoned with coriander and pepper. High protein, low fat snack made from premium grass-fed beef.
products.heritage_story: Biltong has been made in South Africa since the 17th century. Our recipe has been perfected over five generations.

products.name: Premium Aged Basmati Rice
products.description: Our premium aged Basmati rice is carefully selected from the foothills of the Himalayas. Aged for 2 years to enhance its aroma and non-sticky texture perfectly suited for biryanis and pilafs.
products.heritage_story: Sourced directly from family-owned farms that have practiced sustainable rice cultivation for generations. Every grain tells a story of tradition and respect for the land.

products.name: Couscous (Traditional)
products.description: Hand-rolled traditional Moroccan couscous. Quick-cooking and fluffy, perfect for tagines and salads.
products.heritage_story: Couscous is the staple grain of North Africa, traditionally prepared by women for family gatherings and celebrations.

banners.title: The Perfect Jollof Bundle
banners.subtitle: Everything you need for an authentic taste of home, delivered in 30 mins.

banners.title: Fresh Organic Plantains
banners.subtitle: Straight from the farm to your doorstep. Sweet, ripe, and ready to fry.

banners.title: Ethiopian Coffee Week
banners.subtitle: 20% off all Ethiopian coffee beans. Experience the birthplace of coffee.

reviews.title: Best jollof spice I've found in London!
reviews.content: This brings back memories of my grandmother's cooking. The blend is perfect - not too spicy, with all the right flavors. My jollof rice has never tasted better!

reviews.title: Authentic taste
reviews.content: Finally found something that tastes like home! The aroma alone is incredible. Will definitely be ordering more.

reviews.title: Coffee perfection
reviews.content: The best Ethiopian coffee I've had outside of Addis Ababa. The jasmine and citrus notes are exactly as described. Beautiful packaging too!

reviews.title: Great quality shea butter
reviews.content: Pure and unrefined as promised. The natural scent is strong but I love it. My skin has never felt better. Would be 5 stars if the packaging was easier to use.

notifications.body: Your jollof rice spices are on the way! Track your package to see arrival time.

faqs.question: How do I track my order?
faqs.answer: You can track your order by going to 'My Orders' in your profile. Each order has a 'Track Order' button that shows real-time delivery updates. You'll also receive push notifications when your order status changes.

faqs.question: Can I cancel my order?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can cancel your order within 30 minutes of placing it, provided it hasn't been prepared yet. Go to 'My Orders', select the order, and tap 'Cancel Order'. After 30 minutes, please contact our support team.

faqs.question: What are the delivery options?
faqs.answer: We offer standard delivery (2-5 business days), express delivery (next day), and same-day delivery in select London areas. Delivery fees vary by vendor and distance. Free delivery is available on orders over £25 from participating vendors.

faqs.question: Do you deliver outside London?
faqs.answer: Yes! We deliver across the UK. Delivery times and fees vary by location. Enter your postcode at checkout to see available options and estimated delivery times for your area.

faqs.question: What payment methods do you accept?
faqs.answer: We accept all major credit and debit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex), Apple Pay, Google Pay, and Klarna (buy now, pay later). All payments are securely processed through Stripe.

faqs.question: How do I use my Zora credits?
faqs.answer: Your Zora credits are automatically applied at checkout when available. You can view your credit balance in your profile. Credits can be earned through referrals, returns, and promotional campaigns.

faqs.question: What is your return policy?
faqs.answer: We accept returns within 14 days of delivery for non-perishable items in original condition. Perishable items cannot be returned but may be eligible for refund if there's a quality issue. Contact support with photos of any damaged items.

faqs.question: How do I become a vendor?
faqs.answer: To become a Zora vendor, visit our vendor portal at vendors.zoraapp.co.uk. You'll need to provide business details, product information, and complete our verification process. We review applications within 5 business days.

loyalty_tiers.name: Silver
benefits: Free standard delivery on orders over £20

dispute_reasons.description: I never received my order or some items are missing
I received a different product than what I ordered
The product arrived damaged or broken
The product quality doesn't match the description
The product was expired or close to expiry
